alert.note: Alert for Carson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 12:46AM CDT until further notice by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, Carson and Hutchinson. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1245 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain has come to an end. However, minor flooding is still possible in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Borger and Skellytown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
